config.question: Which of the following helped to facilitate life in suburbia?

answer_3.response: Suburban life depended on the automobile. Highways and expressways allowed fathers to commute to jobs in the cities, often an hour or more away. Children might ride buses to and from school, but mothers had to drive them to piano lessons and Little League games. Two cars became a necessity for almost every suburban family, spurring the boom in automobile production. In 1948, only 59 percent of American families owned a car; a few years later, nearly every suburban family had at least one vehicle, and many had several.
